Balance PDF file size and quality

spans.text: Balance PDF file size and quality

lines.text: You can select various settings to ensure that your PDF has the best balance between file size,

spans.text: You can select various settings to ensure that your PDF has the best balance between file size,

lines.text: resolution, conformity to specific standards, and other factors. The settings you select depend

spans.text: resolution, conformity to specific standards, and other factors. The settings you select depend

lines.text: on your goals for the PDF that you are creating. For example, a PDF intended for high-quality

spans.text: on your goals for the PDF that you are creating. For example, a PDF intended for high-quality

lines.text: commercial printing requires diﬀerent settings than a PDF intended only for onscreen viewing

spans.text: commercial printing requires diﬀerent settings than a PDF intended only for onscreen viewing

lines.text: and quick downloading over the Internet.

spans.text: and quick downloading over the Internet.

lines.text: About Acrobat PDFMaker
PDFMaker is an Acrobat feature that operates within many business applications, such as

spans.text: PDFMaker is an Acrobat feature that operates within many business applications, such as

lines.text: Microsoft Office applications, AutoCAD, and Lotus Notes. When you install Acrobat,

spans.text: Microsoft Office applications, AutoCAD, and Lotus Notes. When you install Acrobat,

lines.text: PDFMaker controls appear in the work area of the authoring application.

spans.text: PDFMaker controls appear in the work area of the authoring application.

lines.text: Note: Some PDFMaker features are not available in certain versions of the authoring

spans.text: Some PDFMaker features are not available in certain versions of the authoring

lines.text: applications. For a comparison chart, see Compatible web browsers and PDFMaker

spans.text: include link recognition so that hyperlinks, internal document links, and tables of contents are

lines.text: Convert Visio files to PDF (Acrobat Pro)

spans.text: Convert Visio files to PDF (Acrobat Pro)

lines.text: PDFs created from Visio files preserve page sizes and support layers, searchable text, custom

spans.text: PDFs created from Visio files preserve page sizes and support layers, searchable text, custom

lines.text: properties, links, bookmarks, and comments, depending on the conversion settings. To specify

spans.text: properties, links, bookmarks, and comments, depending on the conversion settings. To specify

lines.text: the properties
Acrobat Preferences
(Visio 2010) From the ribbon choose >
When you convert your Visio file, only shapes and guides that are printable and visible in the

spans.text: When you convert your Visio file, only shapes and guides that are printable and visible in the

lines.text: Visio drawing are converted and appear in the PDF. Shapes are converted regardless of their

spans.text: Visio drawing are converted and appear in the PDF. Shapes are converted regardless of their

lines.text: protection or behavior. Shape custom properties can be converted to PDF object data.

spans.text: protection or behavior. Shape custom properties can be converted to PDF object data.

lines.text: When you convert the Visio file to a PDF, you can preserve all or just some layers, or you can

spans.text: When you convert the Visio file to a PDF, you can preserve all or just some layers, or you can

lines.text: flatten all layers. If you flatten layers, the PDF will look like the original drawing, but won’t

spans.text: flatten all layers. If you flatten layers, the PDF will look like the original drawing, but won’t

lines.text: contain any layer information. When flattened, the contents of only visible and printable layers

spans.text: contain any layer information. When flattened, the contents of only visible and printable layers

lines.text: will appear in the converted PDF.

spans.text: will appear in the converted PDF.

lines.text: Convert Visio files
1. If you want to change the PDFMaker conversion settings, do the following. (For

spans.text: If you want to change the PDFMaker conversion settings, do the following. (For

lines.text: information about a setting, place the pointer over the setting to display a tool tip

spans.text: information about a setting, place the pointer over the setting to display a tool tip

lines.text: below.)
(Visio 2010) Choose Acrobat > Preferences
2. If you want to convert each page in the Visio file to a bookmarked page in the PDF

spans.text: If you want to convert each page in the Visio file to a bookmarked page in the PDF

lines.text: Adobe PDF Convert All Pages In Drawing
file, choose > . If this option is deselected,
only the current page is converted.

spans.text: only the current page is converted.

lines.text: 3. Do one of the following:
(Visio 2010) Choose Acrobat > Create PDF .
(Visio 2010) Choose Acrobat > Convert To Adobe PDF .
(Visio 2010) Choose Acrobat > Create and Attach To Email . The PDF file
attaches to a new email message in your default email application.

spans.text: attaches to a new email message in your default email application.

lines.text: Acrobat Create and Send For Review
(Visio 2010) Choose > . The file converts
to an Adobe PDF file, and an email-based review process begins.

spans.text: to an Adobe PDF file, and an email-based review process begins.

lines.text: 4. If you want to include the custom properties of shapes, select that option.

spans.text: If you want to include the custom properties of shapes, select that option.

lines.text: Continue
5. Click .
